results.title: Roses are red
results.creator_credit: Marcella Hayward, Robert Connolly and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Two parking cops (Jacqueline McKenzie and Kris McQuade) journey into the night with the reality of their work weighing heavy whilst they dream of love. Enter Brian (David Wenham) who thinks it is even tougher being a flower seller and the last thing he needs is a parking ticket. This is a delightful comedy that evokes the banalities, difficulties and romance in everyday life.

results.title: Roses
results.brief_description: A woman who lives in a retirement home keeps returning back to the place where she moved out from to tend to the roses, and catch up with her next door neighbour. The flowers are the old woman’s only continuum between past and present, as she struggles to find a way to reclaim what was once hers in the garden that she nurtured when she was independent and self sufficient. Cast includes Martin Vaughn, Lois Ramsey, Lindy Sardelic and Liz Burch.

results.title: Roots
results.brief_description: A remarkable film for its time which shows, by time-lapse microcinematography and the use of animation, details never before achieved of the processes of root growth. Photography by Percy Smith.

results.title: Room to learn (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Joyce Chopra and Early Learning Centrer
results.brief_description: Shows an outstanding preschool facility - the Early Learning Center, Connecticut, whose design is based on the Montessori philosophy that the environment of early schooling affects a child’s learning processes over a lifetime.

results.title: Room for discussion: productivity
results.brief_description: One of a series of films designed for the general public on the subject of industrial productivity. A panel consisting of a leading British economist, a managing director of a large industrial organisation, a prominent trade unionist and a member of the British Productivity Council answer questions and discuss problems put to them by an invited audience representing the general public.

results.title: Room for discussion: group relations
results.brief_description: Examines the nature and function of discussion in both its personal aspects and also in its broader aspects. Intended to develop an understanding of the process of discussion and create an interest in participating in such activity. Explains that discussion brings information to the individual, leads to a broader and richer life and expedites cooperative achievement. Emphasises that discussion is the privilege and responsibility of all citizens living in a democracy.

results.title: Roofs and power
results.brief_description: Highlights the attempts of government bodies to overcome some of the problems that have plagued the high-rise housing estates in Victoria, in the past and still do today (focusing on Park Towers and 229 Hoddle Street in Melbourne). Shows how Housing Commission tenants are becoming involved in the decision-making processes that determine the environment in which they live including better security, vandal-proof walls and different designs for new flats. Also profiles the range and extent of families who live in public housing with one-third single parents, 20% elderly, low income two parents large families, immigrants and homeless youth. There is a 2.1/2 to 3 year waiting list with 43,000 families living in public housing in Victoria. Discusses why these high-rise buildings were built and the political reasoning of both the Liberal and Labor parties for encouraging private ownership. Includes excellent aerial footage of Melbourne (1984). Suitable for upper secondary levels.

results.title: Ron Shelley: civil engineer
results.brief_description: Typical experiences of a design engineer working on road and bridge construction in Papua-New Guinea, illustrating the development role of better communications. Discusses living conditions in Port Moresby. Ron Selley works for the Department of Public Works as a Design Engineer, has designed seventy bridges, and travels to remote areas of the Territory for his work.

results.title: Romper Room
results.brief_description: At last, the longest running and most loved television pre-school program is on video for you to enjoy with your children. Join Miss Susan, Miss Patricia, Miss Helena and Miss Megan, and of course Mr. Do Bee, for all the favourite songs and games from Romper Room.
